title: Secant Lines Approaching Tangent Line
description: Interactive visualization showing how secant lines approach the tangent line as h approaches 0, demonstrating the limit definition of the derivative for f(x) = x^2
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Derivatives
Limits
learningObjectives: Explain how the limit of secant line slopes gives the tangent line slope
Interpret the geometric meaning of the derivative
Connect the algebraic limit definition to visual representation

controls.name: hSlider
controls.label: h
controls.description: Distance from point P to point Q along x-axis

controls.name: xPSlider
controls.label: Point P at x
controls.description: x-coordinate of the fixed point P

variables: secantSlope - slope of secant line PQ
assumptions: Function is the parabola f(x) = x^2
h is always positive (approaching from right)
limitations: Does not show left-sided approach (h negative)
